issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem is a duplicate of an existing issue.
resolution.name: Duplicate

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Upgrading managed/managed-novlan from 4.1.2-> 4.2.0 requires manual config of networking configuration script to the eucanetd network model.  As such it is required to set {{cloud.network.network_configuration}} to the network json description.

I've seen after upgrade that euctl does not show this as a property when describing properties. Also, setting the property gives no output nor does updating the property or describing after setting it.  I am able to see the value when using {{--debug}} with any/all of these actions. Possibly an admin tools issue?

Here you should see the property {{cloud.network.network_configuration}} listed
{code}
[root@h-08 ~]# euctl cloud.network --region localhost
cloud.network.ec2_classic_additional_protocols_allowed =
cloud.network.global_max_network_index = 4096
cloud.network.global_max_network_tag = 4096
cloud.network.global_min_network_index = 2
cloud.network.global_min_network_tag = 1
cloud.network.min_broadcast_interval = 5
cloud.network.network_index_pending_timeout = 35
cloud.network.network_tag_pending_timeout = 35
{code}

Here is an example of describing the property without then with --debug
{code}
[root@h-08 ~]# euctl cloud.network.network_configuration --region localhost
[root@h-08 ~]#
[root@h-08 ~]# euctl cloud.network.network_configuration --region localhost --debug

fields.summary: Create/Read/Update of cloud.network.network_configuration property not written to stdout for upgraded managed mode cloud
